contents.rich_text: ÊÉ≥ÂÅöÊàêËøô‰∏™È°πÁõÆÈúÄË¶Å‰ªéGPTÂíåNotion‰∏§Â§¥ÂÅöÂá∫Âä™Âäõto meet each other in the middle - ÈúÄË¶ÅNotionÂ•ΩÁúãÈ´òÊïàÔºå‰πüÈúÄË¶ÅChatGPTÊú¨Ë∫´ËÉΩÂ§ühandle‰∏çÂêåÁöÑrequest„ÄÇ

Hey everyone! Welcome back to my channel, since it‚Äôs my second video I can now say welcome ‚ÄúBACK‚Äù, and today I will share something that was demonstrated but left out in the last one - how to make a button in Notion to track your progress towards your resolutions and goals.

Notion is a very useful and aesthetic tool that you can use to help manage the things in your life. And what‚Äôs best is that it works on all platforms, whether you have a Mac, Windows, or even just a web browser, and you can access it on your phones and pads as well, so whatever we build today, you can use it at your convenience and track whatever progress that you want to track, at anywhere.

Imagine this: You're using Notion to track your fitness goals, and you've set up a "Workout Completed" button. Each time you finish a workout, you click this button, which automatically logs the date and type of exercise into a linked database. This visual tracking method not only keeps your progress neatly organized but also gives you a satisfying sense of accomplishment with every click. Over time, this button becomes a motivational tool, as you watch your consistency grow and your fitness database expand. It turns the mundane task of tracking into an interactive and rewarding part of your fitness journey.
"So what exactly is a database? And how does that help build our button?

Think of a database like a smart spreadsheet. It has properties, which are like columns that describe your data. Then, there are rows. Each row is a different item, but they all share the same properties, keeping everything neat and uniform. This setup is super handy when you've got tons of data!

Now, each property in a database is unique to that database. Even if two databases have a property with the same name, they're not the same. It's like having two friends named Alex in different circles - same name, different people.

But why use databases for tracking progress? Well, when we're doing something repeatedly, like a daily task, tracking means counting each time we do it. We need a system that's both stable and dynamic. One part stays the same - that's our total goal - and another part changes each time we hit a milestone, like a button click.

In our database, we'll set up properties to do just this. One property will keep track of the total number of times we want to do something. Another will count how many times we've actually done it. Simple, right?
Let's jump right in and see how this works in action!"
So here we are! Same process as before, let‚Äôs start by creating a new empty page.
And again we will choose our favorite emojis (grow) and background image (clicking phone).
Now we move on to the actual contents, which we will create 4 parts
So while we‚Äôre at it let‚Äôs make the database part be able to toggle so we can have a more simplistic view.
Now we create these 2 empty buttons first and we‚Äôll come back to them later, I will create 2 things to track and the idea is if you can make 2 you can make a hundred, so here it is:
And I‚Äôll just drag it over to the side so that these buttons are side by side and we‚Äôre not wasting all that space in 2 rows.
And then the OVERVIEW part is for us to come back to later as well, it will carry the visual segment of things where we can see a progress bar change when we click a button.
NOW FOR THE DATABASE PART, WE WANT TO MAKE SURE THAT WE CREATE THE DATABASES IN THE DROP DOWNS ALIGNED WITH THE TOGGLE HEADERS OTHERWISE IT WILL NOT WORK.
We‚Äôre going to make a small database right here - just for our buttons later to have a place to write stuff into.
(add columns, counter & date created, create tags)

So right here we have this ‚Äúcounter‚Äù column, and the idea is to make all the entries under this column as the number 1, so that when we roll them up later in database number 2, we can sum them up and that‚Äôs the ‚Äúcompleted‚Äù count for us.
Now I think we‚Äôre good for database 1 and now let‚Äôs move to the second one.
We will use this separate database to do the rolling up of that data. By rolling up I mean we will do the sum of things in the counter column in the previous database.
So we will create these columns first
Relations property to link this database with the first one we created
A number property to count the total - this will remain unaffected by the button clicks
A roll-up button to sum the counter property
And finally a formula property to calculate the progress percentages.
We can actually directly choose the type of visualization that Notion supports so that it fits with the overall style we‚Äôre using here.
And then in the names property we will add a row that represents the morning runs and another that represents cold shower.
Finally let‚Äôs go back to the overview part and create a view for the roll-up database to visualize things better.
So now let‚Äôs program our buttons.
First we want to click on the small settings button
Then we will add a step to create a page in database 1, here remember to keep the counter as 1

Next we add another step to perform the action in database 2, which is the roll-up. Here we will filter for the type of activity first‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ and then pick the relation property that we built in database 2 and choose ‚Äúadd‚Äù and then ‚ÄúNew page added‚Äù - so that should do it.
And now it‚Äôs time to test things out and see how it works.
Basically whenever a button is clicked we will have a page created in database number one which have all our items. But do notice that these pages will all be the same.
Okay! It works, this is so cool, so whenever I finish a run, I can just click a button and watch the bar grow.
This is such a rewarding process!
So that‚Äôs it! And as usual I will provide this as a template and you can copy it to your Notion and program it differently or even add some new ones.

And there you have it! We've just created a smart, interactive button in Notion that's going to revolutionize the way we track and achieve our New Year's resolutions. Remember, the key to success lies in the small, consistent steps we take every day. This button isn‚Äôt just a tool; it‚Äôs your daily nudge towards realizing those big dreams. So, hit that button, stay on track, and let's make this year the one where we turn our resolutions into reality. And also don't forget to like, share, and subscribe buttons for this video! I will post more tips on making the most out of Notion. Remember, it‚Äôs gonna get better!
Keep pushing those boundaries and see you in the next video! Peace!

graph TD
  buttonClicked --> +1
	itemsDatabase --> counterProperty 
	+1 --> counterProperty
	counterProperty -- sums --> completedProperty
	rollUpDatabase ---> completedProperty
	rollUpDatabase ---> totalProperty
	rollUpDatabase ---> progressPercentProperty
	rollUpOverview ---> progressPercentProperty
	buttonClicked --> rollUpOverview
So first let us create a new page
In this page we can pick our favourite or most fitting emojis and background image

Then in the actual contents we will create a new database because we will need that clean and tabular format to compare and see these things as they stack up. A database comes with these 2 default properties and we will use them and add a couple more. But let‚Äôs first create the tags that I‚Äôve previously mentioned. So physical, mental, skills, and personal-goals. Naming stuff isn‚Äôt my strong suit so bear with me as we move along.

So my first goal is to do some morning runs - I really think these are revitalizing and can help me get into a healthier sleep schedule, so here it is - I will do 300 of these. And inside I will first create this sub template that serves as a referencing format to help guide me in terms of the scope and requirements.

Next I think I really need to train for a better performance in general on soccer so I would need to spend some more time in the gym so let‚Äôs make it about once every 2 days. And here you can see once we open up that page we can select the sub-page template we just created and use it in this page.

With all that work I would need a way to recover‚Ä¶ I would want to do ice baths like Jordan Ferrone (left hand) but I think I‚Äôm not Canadian enough yet so let‚Äôs start with cold showers, and let‚Äôs do 180 of them as well.

So that‚Äôs about the physical part - let‚Äôs move on to the mental part. First thing is that I‚Äôm going to read 20 books, and I have a list of books somewhere‚Ä¶ (copies over) that includes not only English literature but also Chinese literature as well because during my trip back home I realized how much Mandarin talking skills I‚Äôve lost throughout the years, so I want to pick that up again and be able to express myself in both languages.

Speaking of languages I want to acquire 2 new languages this year - Korean and Japanese. Hey, I know it‚Äôs a big ambition, but I‚Äôm not going to scope this that far ahead, I will learn how to read, write, listen and speak to the extent that I can use for example Korean to order food and have conversations in restaurants. So I think that‚Äôs doable and would be really cool because I really want to visit both Korea and Japan one day and I sincerely want to speak their language when I‚Äôm in their country so‚Ä¶ there you go, this is a starting point.

And finally for 2 personal goals I have a product in the making that I would like to launch on July 1st - more of that later. And I want to start by posting 100 times on Â∞èÁ∫¢‰π¶ which is a Chinese social media platform where I think I‚Äôd personally have the most chance on making an impact in the longer term.
If you want this simple template, I have a link in description for you to copy this page over to your Notion, so check it out!
And if you like contents about Notion I will post more in the coming videos because my CLV product is exactly about using Notion.
Title: Plan & Track 2024 Resolutions Effortlessly with Notion

[Description]
First YouTube video!!!! In this one, I'm breaking down my 2024 resolutions (which I will most definitely complete this year!) and documenting it easily and aesthetically using Notion. Notion

[Link to my channel]
Follow my YouTube channel:  @lifez-jasonz
